intro: Ideleria hexandra, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals, is a notable botanical feature. Ideleria hexandra is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
